issues.description: The problem statement explicitly requires that "Every class/interface has to be declared public" (problem_statement.md line 5). In the solution, the Pneumatic interface is declared without the public modifier (solution_repository/src/de/tum/in/ase/Pneumatic.java lines 1-9: "interface Pneumatic { ... }"). This makes the interface package-private instead of public, which contradicts the exercise requirement and may confuse students about the required visibility and cause visibility-related test or compilation issues when other code expects a public interface.
issues.suggested_fix: Declare the Pneumatic interface as public in both the template and the solution: change "interface Pneumatic {" to "public interface Pneumatic {". This aligns the artifacts with the problem statement requirement that every class/interface be public.
